So this is Windows XP Professional? What is the difference between home and professional?

xp home Contains basic support for security among multiple users.
Built-in support for peer-to-peer networking, but only for up to five computers.
The backup utility is not installed by default, but is included on the CD. xp pro Administrative Tools (in the Start Menu and Control Panel) 
Automated System Recovery (ASR) 
Boot Configuration Manager 
DriverQuery 
Group Policy Refresh Utility 
Multi-lingual User Interface (MUI) add-on 
NTFS Encryption Utilitiy 
Offline Files and Folders 
OpenFiles 
Performance Log Manager 
Remote Desktop 
Scheduled Tasks Console 
Security Template Utility 
Taskkill 
Tasklist 
Telnet Administrator 
Provides support for multi-processor systems (2 or 4 CPUs), Dynamic Disks, Fax lol way more stuff

I've downloaded this torrent twice and both times it asked me for a key after I mounted and launched it. After I downloaded a keygen and gave it a key on reboot it said hal.dll was corrupt.

lukeroo, you clearly did not follow standard procedures. You were supposed to:
1)Burn the iso to CD at slowest speeds
2)Restart the PC with the CD inside, so you can BOOT OFF OF IT and then follow on-screen instructions.

That said, there is nothing wrong with your hal.dll file. What you need to do at this point is modify your boot.ini file, so that it points to the boot drive, and you'll be able to get back on Windows like you always did. In the future, don't do something if you don't know what your'e doing.

@Jsimpz  When you restart your computer, press F2 to get into BIOS.  Put CD/DVD as your priority boot device.  Save settings.  Your computer will restart and once it's past the splash screen, it will say "Press any key to boot from CD...".  You have 5 seconds to press a key before it loads whatever is on your hard drive.  Hope this helps

** THANK YOU!!! **

i have been dealing with a horribly slow system for two years now, because although my system was supposedly "designed for windows vista", it could barely support the OS. it was always slow, locking up and being a pain in my ass. many sources on the internet and even a family member that works in IT told me that downgrading to XP would be too much of a hassle and to just upgrade my memory. i wouldn't stand for it, because to me 1GB of RAM is more than enough to listen to music and browse the web.

so finally, i recently came across an article saying that the newer intel chipsets have some different aspect to them (i think the integrated graphics maybe?) and that only windows XP with SERVICE PACK 3 support those chipsets. so i came here, found this torrent, and what do you know... windows XP installed FLAWLESSLY, with no errors, and incredibly quick! i just downloaded WMP 11 today, and it passed windows genuine validation.

so to those of you wanting to downgrade from vista, do your research. everyone kept telling me it had to do with SATA hard drive compatibility issues, which apparently was not the case at all. it was chipset support that was only supported by service pack 3.

THANKS AGAIN TO THEGRIMREAPER123!!!! this torrent finally made it possible for me to love my computer! it runs fantastic now.

P.S. if you are downgrading from vista, make sure to have your modem and/or network card drivers saved to disk! thankfully i downloaded my network card driver before installing XP, otherwise i would've had no internet! and you will probably need to manually download your sound card driver as well.

Installed this on vmware without having to burn a disk or use the product key:

Install on Vmware fusion (2.0.5) with mounted image (no need to burn CD) and no product key:

1.  Open Vmware Fusion
2.  Choose File>new
3. In the create New Virtual Machine screen choose "continue without disk"
4.  In the Installation Media screen choose "Use operating system installation disk image file and then navigate to your .iso image in the drop down menu
5.  Select the correct OS in the next menu (windows xp professional...in case you forgot)
6.  In the windows easy install screen unclick "use easy install"
7.  In the finish screen you can either hit finish to complete the installation or choose customize settings to tweek your install.  If you use customize settings, Vmware will first prompt you to save the virtual machine before you continue.

Hope this helps!  Worked perfectly on my MBP c2d.  Thanks for the torrent!!!  Beautiful job!
